cab.content: SECRET.Priority.Operations,Prom :- General Delme Radcliffe, Italy.ToC . 1. G * SWar OfficeDespatched 2.15 p.m. 18th Hov.1917.Received 10.25 p.m. 18th Nov.1917.721. Hoy. 18th. M./lorning.3rd Army.Quiet night. Movements of vehiclesreported towards the left hank of Piave over bridge at C Sacca midday yesterday. Gonfirmed that no enemy troops remsdn on the right bank of Piavc at Fagare and Bartolomeo. 21 machine guns were taken here.4th Army. Intense- artillery fire against positions of Monfenera and Tomba maintains. No infantry attack reported. Several columns of enemy estimated at 7000 to 8000 men aeon marching yesterday tovrards Fener and tvuero. Cij&a Bonato from which Italians were driven November 16th has been partly re-occupied by the 18th Corps.1st Army. 20th Corps has retaken C Mcletta di Gallio taking 80 prisoners, Small enemy attack on Monte Tondarcar was repulsed.3rd Army Corps situation normal.Italian officers escaped from Austrian lines report that they had heard the enemy intended to attack Tomba and Fener night of Nov. 17th but no attack developed.
